April 4, Google announced in an earnings release that the New York Times reported easily beat Wall Street's expectations. Google announced that Eric Schmidt will serve as executive chairman, advising Page and Google co-founder Sergey Brin and concentrating on deals, partnerships, customers, and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership. In a short piece for Harvard Business Review, Eric Schmidt said Google's strategic initiatives are "all about mobile." He said the company must focus on developing high-speed mobile networks that "will

as we make America the best place on Earth to do business, businesses also have a responsibility to America," he told the businessmen in the Chamber. Echoing John Barack Obama 's inaugural speech, he said, I'm hoping that all of you are thinking what you can do for America. Ask yourselves what you can do to hire more American workers, what you can do to support the American economy and invest in this nation. Just how readily U.S. business leaders will take up Barack Obama 's challenge is unclear. with Unequal Technologies, a provider of the football pads Michael Vick wore most of this season. "To sum it all up, the last five months, have been delayed gratification," Michael Vick said. Things that I wanted to accomplish the last couple years that I couldn't and I had to wait for it, and I had to be patient, and I did it and it all paid off. I just thank God for putting me with the right group of people, with Andy, with a flagship organization, a great group of coaches.... They give me all the credit, but I give them the credit. Page, now 37 and graying. While Eric Schmidt travels the world meeting with business partners, government officials and potential takeover targets, Page says he will be making most of the big decisions as he tries to rekindle the soul and passion of a startup. Google Inc. 's other founder, Sergey Brin , will concentrate on developing new products. Page is worth$ 15 billion, but he remains something of a rebel who has always had a disdain for corporate

The pro-plan union members avoid the streets and meet at an auditorium to listen to their leadership. "The crisis has been under way for three years," the man on the podium says. Many industries are dying, banks are holding on to their money, if nothing improves, unemployment will skyrocket this year. We want to ensure our future. That's why we broke labor unity and approved the Sergio Marchionne plan. The union that's been left alone is the powerful left-leaning metal workers. If its members don't agree to sign, Sergio Marchionne says they will lose their representation rights on the factory floor.
